data.title: Improve letterpress shortcuts
data.body:
First:
- What does `Open File in Folder` mean? Why not `Quick Open`?
- Why is `Move Lines Up/Down` in there? As a matter of fact, why are `Add Cursors` and `Open Terminal` too? We should just give the user the essential to get started, not random commands that make us look cool.

Finally, a little bit of styling care goes a long way:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/18863811/98ecf598-8493-11e6-81f4-f45263969f07.png)

data.title: Shortcut, Shortcut Tooltip for "Replace Next" "Replace All "
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.5.3
- OS Version:win 10

I hope for Replace there is keyboard shortcut to use,  for "replace next ", "replace all" function,

besides, when mouse hover on the replace Button, the tooltip will show what the shortcut is.

Thanks.

reference img:
http://i.imgur.com/PbWbwKY.png

(In fact I think this function is similar to visual studio which is Alt R and Alt A, but i wonder why vscode didn't inherit it)

data.title: LineNumber config variable in launch.json and tasks.json

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Launch.json and tasks.json currently support several config variables (https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/tasks#_variable-substitution)
However I could not find the ability to know the currently selected line in the current file.
Adding this variable will allow such tasks as running the test under cursor with external command without writing a full blown extension for it.

As I understood the file responsible for adding config variables is the following: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/62d4b783965fcabc431c786146917593a2772b3d/src/vs/workbench/services/configurationResolver/node/configurationResolverService.ts#L77
I could also find a code from vscode-go that allows running test under the cursor:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-go/blob/0e5a97fa5cfd4e3b37e5b2fbfbf9c788f0381878/src/goTest.ts#L44

data.title: Investigate to update to Electron 1.3.7
data.body:
This brings a node.js update (6.5.0) that reverts the questionable `fs.realpath` implementation back to how it was in node.js 4.x. 

We have to decide if we want to make this move so late in the game.

data.title: Patched bits: issue reporting should mention it
data.body: When reporting an issue from a corrupt installation.

data.title: The scrollbar of integrated terminal disappear
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.5.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open the integrated terminal
2. excute some command
3. the scrollbar disappear

data.title: Ability to disable extensions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (be5e8d5733c1c012d7e3a6c7e049b59d67c13978, 2016-09-26T06:05:01.421Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.0.0

It would be great if one could disable extension (as opposed to uninstalling it)

Something similar to how Chrome allows to Disable or Uninstall extension

data.title: Remove extraneous "..." that breaks gulpfile
data.body: Not sure if I'm missing something but the "..." in the gulpfile breaks gulp for me. Removing it seems to allow me to build as normal.

data.title: auto refrsh task output should refresh the main screen too
data.body:
VSCode Version: 1.5.3  with pythonVScode
OS Version: win10
Steps to Reproduce:

use vscode to run any python server application, like Odoo
open file in main screen, and show the command output. move the mouse cursor to any lines, when the command output refresh, the main screen should be refresh too. 

see  ref. to #12300 
![animation 9](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1404460/18858477/f62e84be-849e-11e6-9ab2-4155339f7520.gif)

data.title: javacript code formatting not working after typescript v2.x update
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0 insider
- OS Version: Windows 7 64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. update to latest VS Code insider v1.6.0 and update typescript to v2.0.x
2. format the javascript code with below workspace settings.
   "editor.tabSize": 2,
   "javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterKeywordsInControlFlowStatements": true,
   "javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterFunctionKeywordForAnonymousFunctions": true,
   "javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterOpeningAndBeforeClosingNonemptyParenthesis": false,
   "javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterOpeningAndBeforeClosingNonemptyBrackets": false,
3. above formatting settings are not adhered after typescript v2.0x update

tabsize is 4 and not using above override and spaces are not getting added after function keyword and parenthesis/brackets.

data.title: Bgashler1/watermark tweeks
data.body:
Smoothly responsive to window height.  Never interferes with branding logo.  Vertically aligned to middle with branding logo.

Darkest possible text while still meeting minimum accessibility compliance.

Initial fade in added to speak to the user "hey, this is not an editor"

![sep-26-2016 18-43-35](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11839736/18857481/2d70033e-8419-11e6-9884-5b14fbb84afb.gif)

![screen shot 2016-09-26 at 6 37 31 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11839736/18857438/bdaa776e-8418-11e6-9016-4f3bc6d42099.png)
![screen shot 2016-09-26 at 6 37 40 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11839736/18857439/bdbd90f6-8418-11e6-80d7-f255f48ac43a.png)

data.title: Allow to install more then one extensions and enable all together
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Extensions
2. Type, for example: Java
3. Now we need to install: Java Debug, Java Properties and Java Snippets
4. I need to install each one and restart VS Code, seach extension again and repeat this process

My sugestion is: I can install more then one extension and after this I can restart VSCode. Like Visual Studio Extensions.

data.title: Improve Markdown Html Block Colorization
data.body:
Updates the markdown grammar to better match CommonMark's handling of html blocks: http://spec.commonmark.org/0.26/#html-blocks

This change:
- Adds special case to handle html comments. This fixes #12692
- Add a case to handle block level html elements (case number 6 in the common mark spec). This fixes a number of edge cases.
- Support using any tag names if it looks like html according to case number 7 in the common mark spec.

Closes #12692

data.title: Markdown Incorrect Highlighting When Html starts with Comment
data.body:
For a markdown file like this: ``` md

**I should not be colorized**

``` The current rendering is: ![screen shot 2016-09-26 at 3 44 51 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/18854423/2f3fdf36-8400-11e6-9975-5b87c9c27526.png) The markdown text inside the `

` is getting highlighted as bold text, even though it is actually html content.

data.title: Test: Monarch tokenizers for html, php, razor and handlebars
data.body:
- [x] Any OS @isidorn 

Complexity - 4

I would very kindly appreciate a smoke test for the monarch tokenizers I've written for the standalone editor languages. I am not so much interested in the tiniest of details, I was aiming for a quality similar to what we had before.

Please check what we had before: https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/

Please check what we have now:
- clone https://github.com/Microsoft/monaco-editor
- `npm install .` (!!! to get latest monaco-editor-core, monaco-languages)
- open `monaco-editor/test/index.html`

Go through some examples files for the 4 languages and check that they are colored at a similar quality level as before.
